I am not able to achive this."Proper nutrition, physical exercise, and managing your weight helps to control your glucose [blood sugar] levels. See this on diabetes nutrition http://tinyurl.com/5t5qxzIf you continue to struggle with your glucose levels, do not hesitate to mention it to your doctor.Good luck

thank you however that just worrys me more. my levels are not super high and i reckon im just going to talk to my doctor about what levels cause defects and if i am at risk.  thank you for your research though. i am greatful

question: Hi..I have been diabetic for about a year now and i just found out i was prego about a month ago. I am concerened with what happens in pregnancy when you are diabetic. I know the doctor is wanting to gt me down to 125 during the day and 95 in the morning. I am not able to achive this.  what does this do to the baby?  Im worried that the baby will suffer.. any help on this will be greatly helpful.. thank you
title: Im diabetic and newly pregnant
